February 18
In The Wire, when Stringer Bell and Avon Barksdale think they‚Äôre about to both be arrested, Stringer turns around and puts his hands behind his back, thinking he‚Äôs about to get handcuffed. [link]

For reasons you‚Äôll know if you watch the show, the police could only get a warrant for Avon. McNulty says to Stringer, ‚ÄúCatch you later.‚Äù I thought about that scene when watching the video of Tamara Lich getting arrested but not the guy standing next to her.
‚ÄúHow long were the protesters planning to paralyze Canada‚Äôs 8th best city?‚Äù [link]

@GroundhogDayMxM When you come to the minute where Phil takes his date, both dressed up in costumes, to see the movie Heidi II, can you talk about how he pauses when he says ‚ÄúThat‚Äôll be, uh, one adult and, uh‚Ä¶‚Äù and she says ‚ÄúTwo adults!‚Äù That‚Äôs weird, right?
@CatherineOmega [link]

@1Password If I‚Äôm required change my password every 3 months, I set a reminder to do it every 2 months, so I can do it at any point during the day. Even though 1Password makes the process somewhat quick, I never want to have to do it in the middle of a critical moment.

Otherwise never.
February 15
It‚Äôs easy to wonder, sometimes, what lists my name is on, and what implications that has had.

I don‚Äôt see my name on a certain list that‚Äôs making the rounds currently, so that‚Äôs a good sign. (Hey, you never know. I regularly get emails intended for my Swedish namesake.) My family name, the one on my government-issued ID, is there, but no relation.
*Owen Wilson Wow* [link]

Anybody else have mixed feelings about shutting down North American and European cities in response to threats by people to shut down North American and European cities? [link]
In response to a threat to shut down a section of downtown Toronto, we are shutting down a section of downtown Toronto. [link]
This is what it‚Äôs going to be like every weekend forever, I assume. [link]

The downtown core of Toronto this weekend is a lot like the downtown core of Toronto mid-to-late February 2022. There‚Äôs obvious differences, of course, but those are far outweighed by the similarities.

subs.text: If Twitter unblocks my developer account, I‚Äôll make a bot that tracks the percentage of triple-jabbed Canadians. [link]

No matter how you slice it*, 4/5 of Canadians are fully vaccinated. * Depending on how you count booster shots. Still, this is for the entire Canadian population, including those not yet eligible. [link]
@BryanPassifiume Hey @lemonodor, do you find this of interest?

@joshtpm In Toronto over the weekend, a protest was allowed but on foot only. The police closed streets into the downtown core for all vehicles (except emergency vehicles). The provincial legislature is right next to a number of large hospitals, so there was zero tolerance for a blockade.
February 9
@CatherineOmega ‚ÄúHave you tried mindfulness?‚Äù That‚Äôs my go-to when I want to be truly unhelpful.
@CatherineOmega Weird, no unhelpful men in your replies to that one. *kicks Twitter* Is this thing on?
@Kimli It‚Äôs important that I tell you this: I‚Äôve thought about this tweet four days in a row now.
@jeffjedras [link]
@geerlingguy Nice.
@AP_Planner @MLB ‚Ä¶is scheduled to begin.
February 8
Except that Ontario waits to see what B.C. does and whether or not it works. [link]
@blogTO Burrito Gordito. [link]

@larrylarry I‚Äôm not worried whether they will. For me, it‚Äôs a given. It needs to be part of the restrictions lifting plan to have a clear message about why they are being lifted. Will it be politicized? Almost certainly yes. We need to think ahead with that in mind.
I‚Äôm scheduled to get my booster shot tonight, and I have to say, I‚Äôm not as eager to get it as I was for the first two doses.
After AstraZeneca, then Moderna, I went with Pfizer (or, as I like to pronounce it, Pfiz√®re) for my booster. I collected ‚Äôem all. The vaccine trifecta! The vax-trick!
All I could think about when I got my third dose of the COVID-19 vaccine was Dr. Nick injecting painkillers into Mr. Burns and saying ‚ÄúTime for a booster!‚Äù [link]

48 hours later, and I‚Äôve had some health effects, all minor, which I don‚Äôt have a strong explanation for other than the shot. This is why I didn‚Äôt have a lot of enthusiasm for this one. I‚Äôd still rather this than catching The Virus without one, two or three jabs.

My name day is April 3rd in Czechia, Slovakia, France, and Hungary. Therefore I‚Äôve decided to celebrate it today as well as April 3rd.
I learned about name days from Game of Thrones. [link]

February 2
@ReneeStephen I think about the line ‚ÄúYou won't know who to trust!‚Äù at least once a day.

@gruber It‚Äôs much worse now. The URL parameters for your tweet are now ?s=20&t=Uq-PGGbt4Zv9UBysEynfdg for me. Presumably it identifies where exactly I saw the tweet, i.e. visiting the tweet from your timeline, via the Twitter Web App, while logged in as me.
*Owen Wilson Wow* [link]
How‚Äôs Peter MacKay‚Äôs French these days? [link]
How‚Äôs Lisa Raitt‚Äôs French these days? [link]
How‚Äôs the French of the top 6 people on this list these days? [link]
Today‚Äôs my balloon day, the anniversary of my joining @Clubhouse!

I‚Äôm a regular member of Pause Breathe Reflect, a 4-times daily 5-minute group meditation, and anybody can join the kitchen (‚Äúwhere the real party happens‚Äù), as the leader calls the speaking area, or stay in the living room.
PBR breaks up the day nicely, and I don‚Äôt have to do anything but listen. Everybody in the room is greeted by name, something I haven‚Äôt experienced in any other room.

One club I enjoy has a fortnightly room where we practice not saying words like ‚Äúum, ah, you know‚Äù in speeches where you have no time to prepare. The word I want to let go of in my speech, in addition to the ones we practice, is ‚Äúlike‚Äù.

If you treat ‚Äúum‚Äù and ‚Äúah‚Äù and ‚Äúyou know‚Äù as punctuation, then replacing them in your mind with ‚Äúcomma‚Äù or ‚Äúperiod‚Äù (without saying either the filler words or the punctuation words), it makes you sound thoughtful. Through this I realized that I laugh as punctuation as well.
‚ÄúDoes that make sense?‚Äù is also punctuation. In this room, I was challenged to not end explanations that way, and let it be up to the person listening to tell me if they don‚Äôt understand.
I‚Äôm watching the movie Groundhog Day on repeat today.
That‚Äôs from the movie Groundhog Day! [link] https://t.co/AzpKIMZ2Dd
First viewing is in the books. On to the second!
Second viewing is in the books. On to the third!
This would have been a lot of fun, but I couldn‚Äôt do it tonight. Maybe next year! [link]
Third viewing is in the book. On to the fourth!
Fourth viewing is in the books! Schluss f√ºr heute!
[link]

One picks up a lot about a movie from watching it 4 times in one day. Like how Phil* flips the bird in one of his countdowns, and how unsettling parts of it are, like the Nancy Taylor sequence, and how Phil* is like Pep√© Le Pew in one scene.

* The weatherman, not the groundhog.
This is the second year I‚Äôve done this exhausting tradition. Here‚Äôs the thread when I did it last year: [link]
Here are links to the articles I‚Äôve read about the movie Groundhog Day over the years: [link]
I ultimately watched Groundhog Day 4 times yesterday, the last viewing on what I call ‚ÄúAirplane Mode‚Äù (sound off, captions on).
[link]
This is the second year I‚Äôve done this exhausting tradition. Here‚Äôs the thread when I did it last year: [link]

One picks up a lot about a movie from watching it 4 times in one day. Like how Phil* flips the bird in one of his countdowns, and how unsettling parts of it are, like the Nancy Taylor sequence, and how Phil* is like Pep√© Le Pew in one scene.

* The weatherman, not the groundhog.
Oh my goodness, there‚Äôs a podcast that goes over Groundhog Day minute by minute. @GroundhogDayMxM [link]
February 1
British Columbians, please read Go Do Some Great Thing by @Crof this month. Check to see if your local library has a copy, and if it‚Äôs not in their stacks, please make a purchase request. [link]
In celebration of Lunar New Year, I tried my hand at making my favourite meal, chicken curry noodle. [link]
I had spaghetti noodles that I‚Äôd never use up otherwise, so that explains that. The soup didn‚Äôt come out as thick as I‚Äôm used to. This was most definitely a first effort.
For the next efforts, I‚Äôll use better noodles, and figure out what to do less and/or more of for the soup.
It‚Äôs just as spicy as I‚Äôm used to, though, oh my goodness. I‚Äôm getting capsaicin drunk tonight!
I‚Äôve only ever had it from Singaporean-Malaysian hawker joints in Vancouver, which are hard to come by in downtown Toronto.
It wouldn‚Äôt be Lunar New Year without crunchy snacks! [link]

Second attempt at chicken curry noodle, this time with potatoes (slightly overcooked, but cooked to the taste I remember) and a different kind of noodles (also overcooked). The soup is better but still not quite thick enough. Not a bad second effort, I must say. [link]
If there was an app like @SwarmApp where you could check into a meal, and become the mayor of that meal, I‚Äôd definitely be the mayor of chicken curry noodle, no question.

subs.text: I‚Äôll make it soon again with potatoes. That was something I was missing as well.
Fritters on the side would be a stretch. A delicious stretch.

@rtanglao Every day has been March 13th, 2020 for me, since that‚Äôs when lockdown started for me. But really, every day has been different enough for me that I never got caught up in the ‚ÄúGroundhog Day‚Äù-ness of the pandemic that some others did. I was never bored since it started.

Due to Lunar New Year falling on February 1st, I‚Äôm extending saying ‚ÄúHappy New Year!‚Äù for a few more days. I defer to others as to how long we are saying that to those we wish it to, though, as my legal authority ends now.
